It spread throughout the world, with banners and stūpas.
There were many who recited and upheld it.
Since I was young,
I have always recited and upheld it.
In the beginning of the Yongtai era,
after losing my wife,
I redoubled my efforts in mind and spirit.
Seeking the Dharma of liberation,

original: 時有殿中侍御史蔣那者。
analyzed: 時有殿中侍御史蔣那者。
translated: at that time there was a Palace Attendant Censor Jiang Na,

One day in his private quarters,
he suddenly came and said,
Now I have attained the ultimate path.
It is extremely difficult to encounter.
Zhijing asked about it.

analyzed: 命之令誦。 而文句全廣。
translated: He was ordered to recite it.🔽But the text was very long.
The pronunciation and meaning were quite different.
He bowed and recited it.

original: 開士受之於金剛智三藏。
analyzed: 開士受之於金剛智三藏。

Even in the Western Regions, this version is rare.
I will bring the Sanskrit original.

I did not obtain the original text.
Soon after, he died under punishment.
I always felt regret for the loss.
I regretted not being able to reach it.
Whenever I encountered a learned person,
I would ask about it.
Hoping for even a one in ten thousand chance.
I finally met Monk Ji.
Sure enough, he had this text.
During the Kaiyuan era,
under Mount Wutai,
there was an ascetic layman.
His surname was Wang.
He had something to do and went on a long trip.
After he left, his father passed away.
When he returned, he could not see him.

original: 至心誦尊勝陀羅尼數十萬遍。
analyzed: 至心誦尊勝陀羅尼數十萬遍。
translated: He recited the Usnīsavijayā Dhāraṇī with utmost sincerity hundreds of thousands of times.

original: 願知見先考所受生善惡業報。
analyzed: 願知見先考所受生善惡業報。
translated: He wished to know the good and evil karmic retributions that his deceased father had received.
His sincerity was earnest.
He was not aware of anything.

analyzed: 遂欲出山。 見一老人。
translated: He then wanted to leave the mountain.🔽He saw an old man.

analyzed: 謂居士曰。 仁者念持。
translated: The old man said to the layman,
Your recitation is indeed diligent.
However, many of the words and phrases are missing.
I will now teach you the complete text and phrases.
The layman bowed and received it.
He said, You can recite it a thousand times.
After several days,
in the middle of the night,
he suddenly heard the sound of jade pendants and flutes.
It descended from the courtyard.
At that time, the layman was startled and looked up.
He saw several dozen heavenly beings,
surrounding a celestial immortal.
The one in front said to him,
Do you recognize me?
The layman replied, I do not know.
The celestial immortal said,
I am your father.
In recent years, I have recited and upheld the Ushnishavijaya Dharani.
I have obtained the power of blessings from this.
Then, in the past few months,
my blessings have doubled compared to the accumulated years.
I do not know which version you have obtained.
That has led to this.
Now, because of your power,

original: 獲為天仙之王。🔽則知汝所持念。
analyzed: 獲為天仙之王。 則知汝所持念。
translated: I have become the king of celestial immortals.🔽It is known that the merit and efficacy of what you uphold in mind
is immeasurable.
After saying this, he ascended.
The layman joyfully bowed and saw him off.
From then on, he became even more diligent.
Later that day, he arrived in the Eastern Capital.

original: 有一專修學人王少府者。
analyzed: 有一專修學人王少府者。
translated: There was a practitioner named Wang Shaofu,
who also had a copy of the Ushnishavijaya Dharani.
He had recited and upheld it for many thousands of times.
Suddenly, in the middle of the night,
he dreamed of a brahman monk coming.

analyzed: 謂小府曰。 賢者念誦。
translated: He said to Shaofu,🔽The virtuous one's recitation
is truly sincere.
But the text of the praised version is slightly mistaken,
and the merit is meager.
Wang Shaofu bowed and earnestly requested the true text.

original: 梵僧乃授之以廣本文句。
analyzed: 梵僧乃授之以廣本文句。
translated: The Indian monk then gave him the extensive text and commentary.
After the commentary was orally transmitted,
the monk sent the Indian monk out the door.
The light was like daylight. When he returned to the bed,
he saw that the servants in the room were still sleeping.
He suddenly woke up and scolded them.
It was already dawn.
The servants said,
It's just past midnight.
Suddenly the light went out in the evening.
Wang Shaofu himself saw something unusual.
He closed his eyes and recited it.
It was clear and smooth.
He became even more diligent.

original: 天寶初五臺山人王居士。
analyzed: 天寶初五臺山人王居士。
translated: In the beginning of the Tianbao era, a person named Wang Jushì from Mount Wutai,
as well as Wang Shaofu,
were both in the Eastern Capital.
They did not know each other.
Suddenly Wang Shaofu died suddenly.
He passed away for seven days and then revived.
Good people in the city
all asked about the reason.

original: 居士乃王開士亦同詣問得再生之由。
analyzed: 居士乃王開士亦同詣問得再生之由。
translated: Wang Jushì also went together to ask about the cause of his rebirth.
Wang Shaofu said,
When I first lay down,
I suddenly saw two messengers come and say,
chasing after and following each other.
Walking for several tens of li,
they arrived under a large tree.
The two messengers rested.
I also rested.
Suddenly remembering the Supreme Victory [Dharani],
I immediately closed my eyes
and recited it twenty-one times.
Raising my eyes to look around,
I no longer knew where the two messengers had gone.
In an instant, four people arrived again.
They knelt and said,
What are you practicing, sir?
What benefits have you obtained?

original: 向來追者二使並得生天。
analyzed: 向來追者二使並得生天。
translated: The two messengers who were chasing me earlier have both been reborn in the heavens.
Wang Shaofu said,
I was only reciting the Supreme Victory Dharani.
The four people said,
It is solely due to the power of this!
Please recite it with your disciples.
Rescue us from suffering and danger!

original: 王少府又冥目誦三七遍。
analyzed: 王少府又冥目誦三七遍。
translated: Wang Shaofu again closed his eyes and recited twenty-one times.
When he opened his eyes, he no longer saw the four people.
In a short while,
he heard the sound of armor in the air.
There was a divine person,
wearing purple robes and armor.
The procession was very grand.
He knelt in front and said:
I am the lord of the five paths of existence.
I am quite a noble position.
But in the end, I am still under the control of the spiritual realm.
I wish to be reborn in the heavens.
As for those six people,
because of the power of the teacher's Dharma,

original: 各得生天。🔽今請迃于音曲󰹓步。
analyzed: 各得生天。 今請迃于音曲󰹓步。
translated: each of them has attained rebirth in the heavens.
Now I invite you to come to my disciple's residence and recite it there.
I hope to receive the remaining blessings and benefits.
They then went together to a pond house,
several tens of li in circumference,
all of which were criminals with shackles, chains, wooden collars, and ropes.
They were imprisoned, sentenced,
and interrogated.
The spirit ordered Wang Shaofu to ascend a high seat,
and himself knelt below the bed
to listen to it.
Wang Shaofu closed his eyes and focused on it,
reciting it forty-nine times.
He raised his eyes to look around,
but he could not see one person.

original: 唯有斷鎖破杻弊械空枷而已。
analyzed: 唯有斷鎖破杻弊械空枷而已。
translated: There were only broken chains, smashed wooden collars, ruined shackles, and empty shackles.
Wang Shao-fu was shocked and terrified.

original: 囚知所適忽然有四五人至云。
analyzed: 囚知所適忽然有四五人至云。
translated: The prisoner knew where to go. Suddenly, four or five people arrived and said,
The king has ordered us to quickly send you off.
You have disrupted us.
You have broken the rules of our underworld.

original: 遂驅逐王少府令入一空谷中。
analyzed: 遂驅逐王少府令入一空谷中。
translated: They then drove Wang Shao-fu into an empty valley.
He then revived and regained his life.

original: 實尊勝陀羅尼不思議之功力也。
analyzed: 實尊勝陀羅尼不思議之功力也。
translated: It is truly the inconceivable power of the supreme dhāraṇī.

original: 於是五臺王山人及王開士。
analyzed: 於是五臺王山人及王開士。
translated: Thus, the people of Wutai and Wangshan, the scholar Wang,
and Wang Shao-fu,
having the same karmic causes,
each presented the texts they held.

The number of characters was the same.
It was like a single text.
They rejoiced with each other.
The person from Wangshan said,
I originally received it from the holy monk of Mount Tai.
Wang Shao-fu said,
I originally received it from the divine monk.
The scholar Wang said,

original: 吾本受之於金剛智三藏。
analyzed: 吾本受之於金剛智三藏。
translated: I originally received it from Vajrabodhi Tripiṭaka Master.
The Sanskrit manuscript is still extant.
The three people were frightened.
They compared the original texts together.
The sounds, meanings, and number of characters were the same.

original: 故知眾生聞法有時流傳教法。
analyzed: 故知眾生聞法有時流傳教法。
translated: Therefore, it is known that when sentient beings hear the Dharma, sometimes the teachings are transmitted.

original: 亦有時歎真實世間希有。
analyzed: 亦有時歎真實世間希有。
translated: Sometimes they praise the true reality as rare in the world.

original: 此即是金剛智三藏梵本譯出者。
analyzed: 此即是金剛智三藏梵本譯出者。
translated: This is what the Tripiṭaka Master of Vajra Wisdom translated from the Sanskrit text.
He compared it with the text transmitted by Buddhapāli.

analyzed: 文句大同。 多於舊本。
translated: The phrases and sentences are mostly the same.
There are nine more sentences and sixty-nine more characters than the old text.
The rest is mostly the same.
Monk Huilin, while compiling the catalog of the Buddhist canon,
Collected more than six hundred scrolls of sūtras that were not yet included in the canon.

analyzed: 前朝蔣大夫行通事舍人張承福。

And the monk from Baekje,

analyzed: 各受持尊勝陀羅尼有功。

There is a record.

original: 琳於成都府右經藏中得之。
analyzed: 琳於成都府右經藏中得之。
translated: Lin obtained it from the right canon in Chengdu Prefecture.

original: 時如意二年三月二十三日。
analyzed: 時如意二年三月二十三日。
translated: On the twenty-third day of the third month in the second year of Yirui.

original: 佛頂尊勝陀羅尼感應事。
analyzed: 佛頂尊勝陀羅尼感應事。
translated: The story of the response to the Buddha's crown supreme mantra.
In the winter of the twenty-sixth year of Kaiyuan.
There was Zhang Yi, the Prefect of the Divine Capital.
Since childhood, he was filial to his parents.
After his parents passed away.
He sank into the evil realms.
He then sincerely repaid their kindness.
He always thought of delivering them.
He then entered the mountains.
Reciting the supreme mantra.
Wishing to see his deceased parents.
And find a place of peace and joy.
He recited diligently day and night.
His voice never ceased.
He earnestly pleaded morning and evening.
He thought of them for six years.
He never saw his parents in his thoughts.
He doubted the mantra was ineffective.
He wanted to give up.
Suddenly he saw an old man with an unusual appearance.
He said:
It's not that the spell is ineffective.
It's also not that you are not sincere.
This is because the time since the sage passed away is long.
Many translations are mistaken.
The spell words are missing.
Therefore, it has lost its efficacy.
The old man then recited it orally.
He ordered him to copy one copy.
Recite according to these words and phrases.
Fulfill seven days.
You will surely see your father.
He immediately followed the old man's oral instructions.
He sincerely paid homage.
When he raised his head, he lost the old man.
He did not know where he was.
Is he a sage?
His feelings were startled.
He became even more devout.
He fully relied on the original text of the teachings.
He recited it with a focused mind.
He had just reached the sixth day.
His deceased parents finally came.
The love between parent and child was not severed.
They wept with joy.
The feelings of the unseen and seen worlds came together.
Their feelings were each deeply moved.
They said:
We have fallen into the great hells.
and suffered various hardships.
The years have passed deeply.
Relying on the son's sincere efforts,
he recently attained rebirth in the heavens.
Now he has come down from the upper realms
to meet you.
His majestic light is slightly different.
The appearance he shows still remains.
He fully recounts the causes and conditions,
just as in the past.
All those who are filial children,
seeing this response,
how could they not pay attention to the holy teachings?
But with an empty stomach filling the mind,
indulging in the six desires,
pursuing joy and entertainment,
what benefit is there?
Moreover, the matter of Maudgalyāyana, the disciple of Śākyamuni, saving his mother,
is fully contained in the sacred texts.
The Prefect's sincerity has this responsive effect.
Later, a monk obtained the recitation of the relics.
The realms were extremely numerous.
He came to the Eastern Capital.
Fully wearing the spiritual events.
He was known by many people.
Later, a good person
requested to spread them in each place.
They are the disciples of the Buddhist gate.
In the middle of the fourth month of the third year of Changqing.
Previously, the magistrate of Fengxian County, Ma Qiu, completed his term.
He returned to his hometown in Qishan.
He lived in the old residence in Shizi Fang, Dongcheng.
He held the original text of the Paritta-Ushnishavijaya Mantra.
For fifteen years.
He never became arrogant.
When he arrived in Qishan.
After several months.
He suddenly dreamed of a divine person wearing armor.
His appearance was very strange.
He said, Since you are diligently reciting this mantra.
Why don't you go to Jingfusi East Corridor Fang.
There is a monk who recites mantras.
He has the original text of the Ushnishavijaya Mantra with spiritual efficacy.
Reciting it has nine times the usual merit.
After saying this, he woke up in shock.
Sweat flowed through his clothes.
The next day, he went straight to the temple to look for the monk.
After several days, he finally met him.
The monk's Dharma name was Yizhi.
When he saw him, he asked about it.
This monk had indeed been diligently practicing this method for a long time.
People from far and near relied on him.
The monk asked,
What is the matter that you are looking for me?
After sitting down,
he told the story of his dream.
[The master] said, How marvelous, how marvelous!
No one has known or understood this original teaching.
Today, young master, you have been instructed by a divine person.
How could I be stingy and not share it?
He then ordered his disciples to take it out of the chest and bring it.
The true teaching was transmitted and received.
He took it back.
He compared it with the old Parītta text he had been holding.
Only then did he realize that the text and phrases were incomplete.
He then practiced according to the new text.
The spiritual efficacy was quite different.
In addition, he further transmitted the two-fascicle Supreme Yoga.
Only then did he realize that the sacred teachings were clear.
They were created with a proper method.
One cannot rely on their ordinary wisdom.
Therefore, he recorded it.
He transmitted it to those with the same aspiration.🔽The Usnīsa-vijaya Dhāraṇī: Namo bhagavate
